title: Find the Greatest Common Factor
text: Find the greatest common factor of all terms in the expression
speech: Find the greatest common factor of all terms in the expression
pacedSpeech: Find the greatest common factor of all terms in the expression

title: Difference of square
text: We observe that $$16$$ can be rewritten $$4^2$$. $$9y^2$$ can be rewritten as ?
speech: We observe that  16  can be rewritten  4 squared .  9 y squared  can be rewritten as ?

title: Formula
text: Recall that $$\left(a+b\right) \left(a-b\right)=a^2-b^2$$, so how can we factor the difference of square for $$9y^2-16$$?

subHints.title: Rewrite
subHints.text: We can rewrite $$9y^2-16$$ as $${\left(3y\right)}^2-4^2$$. Use the formula $$a^2-b^2=\left(a-b\right) \left(a+b\right)$$. We can factor $$9y^2-16$$ as?

speech: Recall that  parentheses a plus b,  times, parentheses a minus b,  is equal to a squared minus, b squared , so how can we factor the difference of square for  9 y squared minus 16 ?
pacedSpeech: Recall that    a plus b,  times,  a minus b,  is equal to a squared minus, b squared
, so how can we factor the difference of square for   9 y squared minus 16

title: Put together all factors
text: $$27y^2-48=3\left(9y^2-16\right)$$ and $$9y^2-16=\left(3y-4\right) \left(3y+4\right)$$. What is the linear factor form of $$27y^2-48$$?
speech: 27 y squared, minus 48 is equal to 3 times, parentheses, 9 y squared, minus 16   and  9 y squared minus 16 is equal to parentheses, 3 y minus 4,  times, parentheses, 3 y plus 4,  . What is the linear factor form of  27 y squared minus 48 ?
pacedSpeech: 27 y squared, minus 48 is equal to 3 times, , 9 y squared, minus 16
and   9 y squared minus 16 is equal to , 3 y minus 4,  times, , 3 y plus 4,
